issue_desc: Also adds documentation of the config in the github wiki closes # 68

Wrapper has 2 significant bugs left : - parse multiline queries properly ( ` db= > SELECT db- > db- > * FROM orders ; ` ) - separate queries properly ( ` db= > SELECT * FROM orders ; db= > INSERT INTO queries VALUES ( 6,6,6 ) ; ` should not parse as ` SELECT * FROM orders ; db= > INSERT INTO queries VALUES ( 6,6,6 ) ; ` ) due to lazily sticking to SELECT as the delimiter .

Current implementation uses hardcoded parameters for these . Pexpect could be used to get at least the username . It could be that we will have to analyse the command-line arguments or environmental variables for other parameters .
issue_comments: Pass real PostgresSQL username , port , host , and password to psycopg

issue_desc: qepparser needs to use SET constraint_exclusion = 'on ' before doing its queries . This makes # 6 trivial search for One-Time Filter 's from the QEP .

issue_desc: Doing : Ctrl-R SELE and selecting : SELECT * FROM orders WHERE order_total_eur = 0 AND order_total_eur = 1 ; leads the wrapper to send `` = > SELE '' as the statement , even if the whole statement can be found in the program output log . Requires work on the wrapper parser .
